Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk tuned
exit 0

exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: tuned bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The tuned packages contain a daemon that tunes system settings dynamically. It does so by monitoring the usage of several system components periodically. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, the tuned daemon did not process block devices without a parent subsystem (for example, root block devices). As a consequence, tuned did not handle device mapper devices. The underlying code has been updated to handle root block devices, and tuned now handles device mapper devices as expected. (BZ#1096132) The tuned daemon sets the read-ahead variable to the value stated in the throughput-performance profile. Previously, when activating throughput-performance profile, tuned set the read-ahead variable irrespective of its original value. If the original value was too high, tuned decreased it, which could lead to a significant performance drop of the operation system and user space components. With the new syntax of throughput-performance profile configuration file, tuned no longer decreases the read-ahead value. (BZ#1096960) Users of tuned are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
